sailpoint.api

Class Differencer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.api.Differencer

  • public class Differencer
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to compare various objects and generate a summary of the differences. Used by the Aggregator to determine when to generate identity snapshots, and can be of general use in custom workflows.

    There are two sets of methods in here, those that calculate Difference objects that describe the differences between two objects, and those that return a boolean value to indicate whether there are any differences between two objects.

    The later methods are used in places where the generation of something (like an IdentitySnapshot) needs to be triggered but all the specific differences do not matter.

      • equal

        public static boolean equal(java.util.Collection list1,
            java.util.Collection list2)
        Return true if two collections are equal. Elements are compared using conatins() which in turn uses equals(). Order of elements is not significant.

        Note that null and an empty list are considered equal. It is hard to keep the various UI beans and internal components from collapsing empty lists to null.

      • equal

        public static boolean equal(java.util.List l1,
            java.util.List l2,
            java.util.Comparator c)
        Return true if two collections are equal. Uses a supplied Comparator to do the comparison. Order of elements is not significant.

        Note that null and an empty list are considered equal. It is hard to keep the various UI beans and internal components from collapsing empty lists to null.

      • contains

        public static boolean contains(java.util.List l,
               java.lang.Object el,
               java.util.Comparator c)
        Return true if an object is contained in a list using the given Comparator rather than the equals method.

      • objectsEqual

        public static boolean objectsEqual(java.lang.Object o1,
                   java.lang.Object o2)
        Return true if two objects are equal. Will forward to Differencer.equal(Collection,Collection) if the arguments are collections.

        When called with Strings "" and null they are returned not equal.

        See Also:
        Differencer.objectsEqual(Object, Object, boolean)

      • objectsEqual

        public static boolean objectsEqual(java.lang.Object o1,
                   java.lang.Object o2,
                   boolean nullAndEmptyStrEqual)
        Return true if two objects are equal. Will forward to Differencer.equal(Collection,Collection) if the arguments are collections.

        Our XML Map objects will nullify any "" values when they have made a round-trip to/from the db.

        Parameters:
        o1 - The first object to compare.
        o2 - The second object to compare.
        nullAndEmptyStrEqual - Whether to treat null and empty string as equal.
        Returns:
        True if the objects are equal.

      • objectsEqualOrContains

        public static boolean objectsEqualOrContains(java.lang.Object o1,
                             java.lang.Object o2,
                             boolean nullAndEmptyStrEqual)
        Return true if two objects are equal or else if either one is a collection, return true if the other is a member of that collection. Return false otherwise. This is useful if you want to find out if an element is equal to or part of the value of an attribute.
        Parameters:
        o1 - The first object to compare.
        o2 - The second object to compare.
        nullAndEmptyStrEqual - Whether null and empty string should treated as equal.
        Returns:
        True if two objects are equal or if either one is a collection, return true if the other is a member of that collection. False otherwise.

      • equal

        public boolean equal(IdentitySnapshot snap1,
            IdentitySnapshot snap2)
        Return true if there are any differences between the given IdentitySnapshots.

      • diff

        public IdentityDifference diff(IdentitySnapshot prev,
                      IdentitySnapshot current,
                      Application app,
                      boolean includePolicyViolations)
                        throws GeneralException
        Genarate a list of differences for the simple attributes of two snapshots. Both snapshots must be supplied. If the given application is non-null, only diffs related to the application are returned. This includes top-level attribute diffs, bundles that reference the application, and link differences for the application.

        The top-level attributes (including organization and manager) are just compiled into a List.

        Entitlement differences are more complicated because they are resource-specific and are stored on the Links. There are two sets, a List for the simple Link attributes and a List for the more complicated Permission model.

        Throws:
        GeneralException
